image.altText: bush fire from above

items.synopsis: Firefighters are still working to control a blaze that swept across an area containing unexploded WWII bombs in northern New South Wales.

title.children: Two emergency warnings issued as bushfires threaten homes and properties

image.altText: nsw police at a crime scene where a woman was found inside a home in Bankstown

items.synopsis: Police allege the 31-year-old man stabbed his mother to death, killed her cat and set the family home on fire in Sydney's south west.

title.children: Son allegedly killed mother a day after being granted bail for attacking her, court told

image.altText: Chris Minns wearing a high-vis vest

items.synopsis: The Minns government has faced calls to allow for pill testing at events in the state following the deaths of two men who attended the Knockout Outdoor music festival in Western Sydney last weekend.

title.children: 'A toxic combination': NSW premier issues drugs warning as man charged over festival death

image.altText: A middle-aged woman in a purple outfit and weading glasses sits on a plush chair with her hands in her lap.

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has left the cash rate unchanged at 4.1 per cent for the fourth month in a row at Michele Bullock's first meeting as governor, but warns another rate hike may be needed as uncertainty grows around oil prices.

title.children: RBA leaves rates on hold at 4.1 per cent for fourth-straight month after Michele Bullock's first meeting as governor

image.altText: Stan Grant in a suit and short

items.synopsis: Michael Steven Davis, 41, allegedly used his Facebook and Twitter profiles to threaten "serious harm" in May.

title.children: Man accused of abusing Stan Grant online has three charges dropped, offers to apologise

image.altText: flames light up night sky behind houses

items.synopsis: Bushfire emergencies are unfolding in multiple states, with hundreds of firefighters battling blazes in Victoria while an emergency warning for Flinders Island in Tasmania's north-east has been downgraded. Follow live.

title.children: Fires in Victoria, NSW reach emergency level as Tasmanian fire downgraded

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Loch Sport fire is about 1 kilometre away from the township. CFA Incident Controller Andy Gillham says it's expected to reach the coastal town amid changing wind gusts this afternoon. "That fire has now changed direction and is moving in an easterly direction and is expected to continue to move east this afternoon towards the township of Loch Sport," he says. "We've asked people in Loch Sport this morning to stay where they are and shelter ... or move to a safe area." He says there's only one road in and out of Loch Sport which has been affected by fire. There is a temporary relief centre set up at the Loch Sport Marina. "If there are going to be impacts on Loch Sport, we expect the impacts to be on the immediate western end of town, and we've got lots of appliances from CFA and FRV and other agencies there to minimise any impact," Gillham says. "There's a very narrow strip of vegetation that lies between the main road and the lake itself, and there is potential for the fire to move right along that strip and it'll come very close to those backyards of those homes that lie on that strip." He says authorities are not expecting significant impacts but they want the community to be alert. Conditions are expected to ease after the cool change at around 5pm AEDT.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Wind change expected to bring fire closer to Loch Sport township

children.content: The Loch Sport fire is about
1 kilometre away
from the township.
CFA Incident Controller
Andy Gillham
says it's
expected to reach the coastal town amid changing wind gusts
this afternoon.
"That fire has now changed direction and is moving in an easterly direction and is expected to continue to move east this afternoon towards the township of Loch Sport," he says.
"We've asked people in Loch Sport this morning to stay where they are and shelter ... or move to a safe area."
He says there's only one road in and out of Loch Sport which has been affected by fire.
There is a
temporary relief centre set up at the Loch Sport Marina

"If there are going to be impacts on Loch Sport, we expect the impacts to be on the immediate western end of town, and we've got lots of appliances from CFA and FRV and other agencies there to minimise any impact," Gillham says.

"There's a very narrow strip of vegetation that lies between the main road and the lake itself, and there is potential for the fire to move right along that strip and it'll come very close to those backyards of those homes that lie on that strip."
He says authorities are not expecting significant impacts but they want the community to be alert.
Conditions are expected to ease after the cool change at around 5pm AEDT.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: An emergency warning has been issued for the Abernethy area, west of Newcastle, due to a bushfire on Allandale Street in Kearsley. The NSW Rural Fire Service says if you are in the area, then you are in danger. "It is now too late to leave," they say. "Seek shelter now inside a solid structure such as a house."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: NSW residents in Abernethy told to shelter now

children.content: An
emergency warning
has been issued for the
Abernethy
area, west of Newcastle, due to a bushfire on Allandale Street in Kearsley.
The NSW Rural Fire Service says if you are in the area, then you are in danger.
"It is now too late to leave," they say.
"Seek shelter now inside a solid structure such as a house."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Phil Graham lives in Stockdale, north-east of Briagolong, and has been fighting the east Victoria fire since 1am AEDT. He says firies have been able to save a section of pine plantations. "[It's] pretty much just young pine, which we have lost most of. "But we're pretty luck we've been able to keep it out of the mature pine forest which is a fairly big asset for the plantation people so we're pretty happy about that. "That's a big win for us."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 'That's a big win for us': Gippsland firies save valuable pine forest

children.content: Phil Graham
lives in Stockdale, north-east of Briagolong, and has been fighting the east Victoria fire since 1am AEDT.
He says firies have been able to save
a section of pine plantations.
"[It's] pretty much just young pine, which we have lost most of.
"But we're pretty luck we've been able to keep it out of the mature pine forest which is a fairly big asset for the plantation people so we're pretty happy about that.
"That's a big win for us."

image.altText: Brown coloured water in a dam

items.synopsis: Water running through the Grenfell-district property was also found to have a pH the same as "stomach acid", according to evidence heard by a NSW inquiry into heavy metal impacts.

title.children: Cadmium at 50,000 times the legal level found next to farm near disused gold mine, inquiry told

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair cries while sitting in a police interview room

items.synopsis: Biannca Edmunds has been sentenced to 26 years' jail after a botched assassination plan she hatched with her husband, targeting her ex-partner, resulted in both mens' deaths.

title.children: Judge says woman showed 'extreme' entitlement by plotting to kill her ex-partner over custody issues

image.altText: City office-workers and passers-by watch the ASX board in Sydney

items.synopsis: The local share market falls sharply as investors bet on interest rates staying higher for longer, while the value of the Australian dollar, gold and oil suffer heavy losses. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX wipes out all its gains of 2023, RBA keeps rates on hold but doesn't rule out future increase

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Reserve Bank has left the cash rate on hold at 4.1 per cent for the fourth month in a row but has not ruled out future increases to return inflation to target. The decision leaves the cash rate at its highest level since April 2012. Tuesday's board meeting was the first chaired by Michele Bullock, who replaced Philip Lowe as the central bank’s governor last month.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: RBA leaves rates on hold for another month

children.content: The Reserve Bank has left the cash rate on hold at 4.1 per cent for the fourth month in a row but has not ruled out future increases to return inflation to target.
The decision leaves the cash rate at its highest level since April 2012.
Tuesday's board meeting was the first chaired by Michele Bullock, who replaced Philip Lowe as the central bank’s governor last month.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: You can tell things are getting a little gloomy when the share market falls back to where it was when the year began. The ASX 200 has now fallen 0.8% since January 1 (as you can see in this chart below). Looking at it another way, the last time it fell to this level (6,942 points) was March 20, so the benchmark index is technically at a six-month low.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australian share market erases all of this year's gains

children.content: You can tell things are getting a little gloomy when the share market falls back to where it was when the year began.
The
ASX 200
has now fallen 0.8% since January 1 (as you can see in this chart below).
Looking at it another way, the last time it fell to this level (6,942 points) was
March 20
, so the benchmark index is technically at a six-month low.

props.alt: A line graph showing the ASX 200 is back to where it was when the year began, after recent heavy falls.

children.content: The ASX 200 has wiped out all its gains for 2023.
(Eikon)

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The local share market has recovered some of its earlier losses, but it's still very much in negative territory. The ASX 200 was down 1.4% to 6,936 points, by 12:25pm AEDT. Healthcare is the only sector trading higher, led by gains from Resmed (+1.2%) and CSL (+1%). Mining and energy stocks are still the worst performers, including Perseus Mining (-4.8%), Beach Energy (-4.8%) and Evolution Mining (-4.4%), after a big drop in gold and oil prices overnight. The Australian dollar is trading at 63.55 US cents (having lost more than 1% overnight), and remains near an 11-month low.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Markets at midday: ASX 200 falls 1.4 per cent

image.altText: A man stands with two woman, wearing white t-shirts with a baby's name and photo on the front.

items.synopsis: Jake Robert Luscombe will be eligible for parole in October 2026 after shaking a baby girl to death.

title.children: Man sentenced to five years in prison for shaking death of seven-month-old

image.altText: A woman, covering her head in a blanket, sits looking upward, surrounded by barbed wire

items.synopsis: Several hundred migrants in southern Mexico wait for buses to the country's north in a new government program meant to help manage the number of people entering the country.

title.children: Mexico sends buses to collect migrants as thousands reach US border

image.altText: Anika Wells speaks in parliament.

items.synopsis: The federal Labor minister was diagnosed with an autoimmune disease during her first pregnancy and says, like others with invisible diseases, she does not want people drawing their own conclusions about her illness.

title.children: Why Anika Wells doesn't publicly name her chronic illness

image.altText: Composite image of two photos of a man - a selfie with him smoking a cigar and a mugshot. Around him are passport stamps.

items.synopsis: The work undercover operatives and sources do is a key weapon against organised crime. These men say our law enforcement agencies have abandoned them.

title.children: This Australian is sitting in a foreign prison cell. He's ready to come clean about his life undercover

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has kept interest rates on hold, but more hikes are expected later this year as 550,000 people come off fixed mortgages. The RBA itself warns that could put more people in financial stress, writes Nassim Khadem.

title.children: RBA warns 'solid middle-to-upper-income' people are the new borrowers in financial stress

image.altText: Hudson pear on the Menindee Plains in far west NSW.

items.synopsis: A highly invasive cactus species is proliferating across the region, prompting the use of drone technology to identify the severity of the outbreak.

title.children: This plant can maim animals and penetrate tyres — and it's spreading across far west NSW

image.altText: A boat moored by a small jetty with an orange fire burning in the background over the water.

items.synopsis: Spot fires are flaring up 11 kilometres ahead of an East Gippsland fire front that has residents in an isolated coastal town preparing to evacuate by boat.

title.children: Victorian residents prepare for boat evacuations after Gippsland town cut off by bushfires

image.altText: Illustration of Australia with night sky and stars in background and yellow circle in middle of Australia.

title.children: Your Voice voting cheat sheet: All your referendum questions, answered

image.altText: a map of eastern australia showing hot temperatures for those parts

title.children: The heat won't stay: Temperatures to drop by as much as 20 degrees in 48 hours

image.altText: Message sign saying about koala deaths on Appin Road

title.children: 'Staggering' number of koala deaths prompts calls for lower speed limit on busy road

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: The survivor of a terrifying shark attack at Beachport in South Australia's south-east initially thought the animal was another swimmer, her husband says — but he has little doubt his wife will return to the water after recovering in hospital and at home.

title.children: Shark that attacked early morning swimmer 'looked like a white pointer', husband says

image.altText: Three people stand in the background, between two purple and white YES signs

items.synopsis: The Yes23 campaign has been asked to keep signs for the Yes vote coloured in purple and white away from Australian Electoral Commission signage.

title.children: Yes23 campaign warned over signs which could 'mislead' voters at polling stations

image.altText: A pilot stands beside heavily-armed rebels in Papua.

items.synopsis: Rebels were armed with military-grade weapons and arrows when a battle broke out between them and a joint military and police force, with the group saying the deaths of their fighters would not lead to their surrender.

image.altText: Kacey and Layne stand together smiling on a suburban street.

image.altText: A seaside suburbia seen from above, with some houses still under construction.

title.children: New calculator tool estimates 40,000 new social and affordable housing will have $4.4 billion benefit

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court and looks straight ahead. The gallery behind him is full of people.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump is fighting a civil lawsuit that could cost him control of his prized properties and his freedom to do business in New York. Here's what happened on day one of the trial.

title.children: Trump doesn't show up to court unless he's forced. Here's why he chose to appear at his fraud trial

image.altText: A line of utes entering a gate.

items.synopsis: On Monday evening an 18-year-old man handed himself in to Wagga Wagga police station where he was charged with three offences, including assault occasioning actual bodily harm.

image.altText: Two people sit on a stage smiling, both wearing t-shirts that say Vote No to the Voice of Division

title.children: Price and Mundine issue rallying cry to No crowd in Perth as Voice vote draws closer

image.altText: A girl sits up in bed, hugging her knees to her chest. Her face is blurred by a sheet of tempered glass.

items.synopsis: ABC Investigations has established more than 1,500 people have reported alleged sexual assaults and harassment in mental health wards over the past six years in Australia. It is launching a national crowdsourced investigation into mental health units and is asking people to share their experiences.

title.children: Florence was allegedly raped in her hospital room. She wants her story told to keep others safe

image.altText: Benedict Cumberbatch in red pyjamas sits in a cross legged meditation position in front of a bright background
